chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thor J Eggum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim.

dated 6/28/16 filed by defendant requesting sentence modification.

The Court has reviewed the Defendant's pro se letter requesting a change in his sentence and denies the request.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thor J Eggum in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended criminal complaint.  State gives sentencing  recommendation.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
